label: theta_12, theta_23, theta_13 = principal axes
reason: Requires Wolfram Alpha API, experimental data, or advanced computation not yet implemented
note: PENDING: theta_12, theta_23, theta_13 = principal axes. Validation: Large angles = 24-pin cage axes
pythonCode:
from core.FormulasRegistry import get_registry
import math
reg = get_registry()

# Values from SSoT
b3 = reg.b3                      # 24 - Pin cage structure
chi = reg.chi_eff                # 144
sterile = reg.sterile_sector     # 163

# PMNS angles from 24-pin cage principal axes
# Large mixing angles = alignment with cage symmetry axes
theta_12 = math.asin(math.sqrt(1.0/3)) * 180 / math.pi  # ~33 degrees (tribimaximal)
theta_23 = 45.0                  # Maximal mixing from b3 symmetry
theta_13 = math.asin(math.sqrt(sterile / (b3 * chi))) * 180 / math.pi  # ~8.5 degrees
verified = 30 < theta_12 < 36 and 40 < theta_23 < 50 and 7 < theta_13 < 10
